Dear Mr. Jones:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Stephanie S Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Education
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4123
Section (2) Provision shall be made for an appropriate education program
Description in accordance with 1976 PA 451, MCL 380.1 to 380.1853. Each
resident of school age shall be enrolled not later than 5 school
days after admission and continuously thereafter.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff are not enrolling youth in school within the required
timeframes.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on March 5, 2024.
Complainant said Osceola Youth Center staff are not completing
the enrollment paperwork entirely and are turning the paperwork
into the school many days after a youth has been placed in the
program.
Superintendent was interviewed via telephone on February
28, 2024. Superintendent said Osceola Youth Center staff are not
submitting enrollment packets to the school within five days
causing many issues for the youth with special education.
Principal was interviewed via telephone on March 7, 2024.
Principal said there have been ongoing communication issues
with the staff at Oceola Youth Center regarding enrollment and the
packet requirements. Principal said she has provided a checklist
several times and once again about a week ago. Principal said at
this time the enrollment timeframe has improved and the packets
are being sent to her timely.
Facility Administrator was interviewed face-to-face on March
7, 2024, and April 18, 2024. Facility Administrator said the case
manager had been responsible for all school enrollment however
recently there has been a change in staffing and the therapist and
Supervisor are completing the school enrollment. Facility
Administrator said to his knowledge the paperwork has been
submitted to the school timely.
Documents Reviewed:
2

A review of the Evart Public School records, information obtained
from the probation officers of three youth, and school records from
Osceola Youth Center were reviewed. Thirty-two youth’s school
files were reviewed in total. Seventeen youth were enrolled into
school within the required five-day timeframe. Fourteen youth
were not enrolled into school within the required five-day
timeframe, ranging from being enrolled on day six to day fifty-
seven. One youth’s file did not have any documentation of
enrollment for the twenty-six days he was place at Osceola Youth
Center.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as fourteen youth were not
enrolled within the required five-day timeframe, and one youth
was never enrolled in school during his placement at Osceola
Youth Center.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There is concern that the youth that are enrolled in online learning
are not being supervised appropriately and have send
inappropriate emails to school administrators from their school
computers.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on March 5, 2024.
Complainant said the concern is not that staff are not in the
classrooms with the youth at Osceola Youth Center, rather that
the staff in the classroom are not making the youth complete their
schoolwork as required by the school. Complainant said the youth
often skip the assignments and will attempt to take the quizzes or
tests by guessing and when they do not pass demand the
teachers unlock the quiz or test so they can do it again without
completing the assignments.
Superintendent was interviewed via telephone on February
28, 2024. Superintendent said the staff at Osceola Youth Center
3

are not monitoring the youth and the youth have sent
inappropriate emails to teachers and administration.
Principal was interviewed via telephone on March 7, 2024.
Principal said her main concern is the lack of educational access
the youth have at Osceola Youth Center. Principal said the school
tracks the login and hours the youth are working on their
schoolwork and Osceola Youth Center youth are consistently not
logging into the computer and will have very few hours worked on
their schoolwork throughout the week. Principal said her concern
is that the staff are not providing adequate supervision to make
the youth complete the schoolwork requirements.
Youth Q was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April
18, 2024. Youth Q said he has been placed at Osceola Youth
Center for about three weeks. Youth Q said there is always a staff
in the classroom supervising the youth. Youth Q said the staff
watch the youth while they are on the computer to ensure they are
not on inappropriate websites. Youth Q said staff will encourage
them to do their schoolwork throughout the day however some
youth refuse.
Youth R was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April
18, 2024. Youth R said he has been placed at Osceola Youth
Center for two weeks. Youth R said youth are never alone in the
classroom and staff are always present. Youth R said staff monitor
the computer usage and do not allow youth on social media or
inappropriate websites. Youth R said staff encourage youth to do
their schoolwork throughout the day. Youth R said staff will assist
youth with schoolwork or help them to connect to the teacher who
can assist them.
Youth S was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April
18, 2024. Youth S said staff are always in the classroom with the
youth. Youth S said staff encourage the youth to do their
schoolwork.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April 18,
2024. Staff 1 said he works first shift and is in the classroom with
the detention youth. Staff 1 said he monitors all the youth on the
computers and makes them sit with their computers facing him.
Staff 1 said he encourages the youth to complete their schoolwork
and will set small goals for the youth throughout the day and has
scheduled breaks for the youth, so they are not staring at the
computer all day. Staff 1 said there are youth that refuse to
complete their schoolwork despite him encouraging them.
4

Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
April 18, 2024. Supervisor said she works first shift and is in and
out of the classroom with both the shelter and detention youth.
Supervisor said staff are always in the classrooms and if they
need a break will radio her and she will sit in the classroom while
they take a break. Supervisor said she always encourages the
youth to log onto their school accounts and complete their
assigned work however some youth refuse. Supervisor said she
and the staff do their best to hold youth accountable to complete
schoolwork. Supervisor said the youth are positioned around the
rooms with the computers facing the staff so they can monitor
what the youth are doing on the computers.
Facility Administrator was interviewed face-to-face on March
7, 2024, and April 18, 2024. Facility Administrator said there is
always staff in the classroom with the youth. Facility Administrator
said the staff encourage the youth to complete the schoolwork and
will assist the youth as much as they can. Facility Administrator
said there are youth that refuse to complete the schoolwork and
the staff do what they can to try to get the youth to log on however
it does not always work. Facility Administrator said the classrooms
are set up with the computers facing the staff desk and as needed
youth will be placed directly next to a staff.
Tour Observation
A tour of the facility classrooms occurred on April 18, 2024.
The classrooms are set up with individual desks that are
positioned around the classroom in a U shape and the computers
all face inward which is where the staff desk is positioned. There
are two youth’s desks that are placed directly next to the staff
desk. All computer screens can be viewed from the staff’s desk.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as youth and staff both report
staff are present in the classroom supervising the youth
throughout the day, and encourage the youth to complete their
schoolwork but some youth refuse to complete work.
Consultation
Technical assistance was offered that the shelter youth that are in
the non-secure setting attend the public school opposed to staying
on campus.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
